titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I began to write the article for 'Edinburgh'
: but made very poor progress, being much interrupted by visitors. After taking Logic for a walk, I called on
whom I found to be in a bad way. D
, who met me just outside the house, said that he was dying, & he said as much to M
, sending her a cheque for ten pounds as a wedding present: also to
asking him whether a service in the Cathedral would be agreeable to the family & the Miners' Association, when old John Wilson has to be buried. This letter I marked 'private'.
